alert.note: Alert for Hill; Liberty (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Liberty and northwestern Hill Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 715 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 36 miles north of Inverness to 17 miles north of Joplin. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Simpson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
